Recent updates in New York include a construction worker's rescue from a manhole, a water-main break causing street damage in the Bronx, and the NY Gaming Board's upcoming vote on new casino licenses, alongside ongoing discussions about local policies and community support initiatives.

### Risks & Alerts

- Construction worker rescued after falling 30 feet down a Manhattan manhole. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMinAFBVV95cUxPXzNwcHVGaGRpM3BmWlRFMkV6Rl9RZ2FQZTlvYU9zYnczYVJ4anNlb1VKRGtTT3gxMlBCWkdUdHFIdVNpRnU2d3pHS1RoVFZ3SGVEUHZTT2x1bjl4dDY0RU84NjJUR1pSYW1QYWViUnlQNWRXeTZ1TEllNTZoWDNyS1QwdWZCNHZUSWlpYkZfWmM2MmFGeFZUQk9PYW8?oc=5)

- Tuesday storm expected to bring rain and possible slush to Staten Island. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
